job.title: Data Scientist
job.description:
Data Scientist
We are seeking a quantitatively talented Data Scientist to uncover data-driven insights to help our partners better attract, develop, motivate, and retain a diverse and inclusive workforce. This role will perform research and analyses for the data team as well as partner with our sales, product development, editorial, and business development functions.
Responsibilities:
Apply expertise in organizational and human capital research, quantitative analysis, and the presentation of data to help customers learn critical insights
Collaborate with data engineering and visualization engineers to access and manipulate data, explain data gathering requirements, and display results
Prepare for customer briefing sessions/meetings, presenting, and addressing pushback from clients and internal stakeholders.
Support the development and advancement of DiversityInc’s benchmarking services.
Partner with the sales, marketing, product development and customer support on projects to identify, analyze and deliver unique insights to our customers
Communicate statistical analyses and results, along with implications, to technical and non-technical audiences
Collaborate effectively with legal, customer operations and data security teams on a variety projects related to data security, methods and privacy policies and practices
Work with COO on select business development related data projects such those related to partnership targeting, partnership conversation and pricing
Minimum Requirements
MS with 5+ years of experience in a quantitative field emphasizing organizational research (e.g., Economics, Data Science, Management, Policy Analysis, Organizational Psychology, etc.)
3+ years of experience conducting quantitative organizational/human capital research in an organization or consulting environment, including working with stakeholders to understand and clarify their research needs
Experience utilizing, managing and analyzing structured and unstructured data with R and SQL
Experience working with Tableau and AWS
Experience communicating technical results to technical and non-technical audiences
Experience defining a roadmap of data requirements, metrics reporting, and research to drive insights
Expert knowledge of statistical analysis (e.g., descriptive statistics and knowledge with statistical significance), quantitative research, and experience gathering and interpreting data
Experience working with business-related data to generate internal business insights which will help shape our corporate strategy
High degree of
independence
,
self-motivation
, and
adaptability
.
Preferred Qualifications
Doctorate degree in a quantitative field
3+ years of experience applying multivariate statistical methods to human capital & organizational effectiveness research topics
5+ years of progressive consulting or corporate work experience 3+ years of experience in analytics, management consulting, operations, or related fields
Building interactive and complex data visualizations and analysis tools (e. g., Dynamic Dashboard)
Experience working with REST API (HTTP computer-to-computer API for automated requests and responses)
Web visualization, Web development and Web programming (e. g., JavaScript, etc.)
Software engineering principles and project managements (e. g., Agile methodology development, etc.)
Version control and git
Location
This is a remote position. However, it's a bonus if you're located within a commutable distance from our offices in Northern New Jersey.
Salary Range
Competitive base + full benefit package
About DiversityInc
DiversityInc is a fast growing, data-driven, DEI services firm that helps iconic companies create inclusive workplaces and improve business outcomes. Through our benchmarking, branding, training, and online solutions, we use our industry expertise and analytics to create solutions that work.
You will be surrounded by colleagues who are passionate about diversity and making DiversityInc the leading DEI solution provider. If you are a face-paced, quantitative expert ready to utilize their talents to make a positive impact, we want to hear from you!
